intro: Hieracium levicaule subsp. vulgatiforme, commonly known as the meadow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often reddish underneath. Its yellow flowers appear in clusters and bloom from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
